text: Black men don't like to be called 'boys,' but women accept being called 'girls.'
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: Women who seek to be equal with men lack ambition.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: Sometimes I've been to a party where no one spoke to me for a whole evening. The men, frightened by their wives or sweeties, would give me a wide berth. And the ladies would gang up in a corner to discuss my dangerous character.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: The working men, I'll go by and they'll whistle. At first they whistle because they think, 'Oh, it's a girl. She's got blond hair and she's not out of shape,' and then they say, 'Gosh, it's Marilyn Monroe!'
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: Justice means minding one's own business and not meddling with other men's concerns.
author: Plato
